vaccine_subtitle: This table reflects data publicly reported by correctional agencies about the administration of COVID-19 vaccines to incarcerated people and staff in their facilities. Agencies differ in the number and definitions of variables they report about vaccination, but, to the best of our knowledge, the numbers reported here refer to the number of people who have received <u>at least</u> one dose of a vaccine. Some individuals may have also received a second dose, though it is not always clear from the data. We will add jurisdictions to this table as more data become available.
vaccine_note: Vaccination totals refer to the number of people who have received at least one dose of vaccine. The population value used to calculate the vaccination rate for incarcerated people is from January 2021, and the population value used for staff is the most recent data available. Many of the staff population denominators come from the Marshall Projectâ€™s data.
map_confirmed: Each spike represents the number of incarcerated people who have had COVID-19 within a facility
map_confirmed_immigration: Each spike represents the number of detained people who have had COVID-19 within a facility
map_confirmed_rate: Each spike represents the % of incarcerated people who have had COVID-19 within a facility
map_confirmed_rate_immigration: Each spike represents the % of detained people who have had COVID-19 within a facility
map_deaths: Each spike represents the number of incarcerated people who have died due to COVID-19 within a facility
map_deaths_immigration: Each spike represents the number of detained people who have died due to COVID-19 within a facility
map_deaths_rate: Each spike represents the % of incarcerated people who have died due to COVID-19 in a facility
map_deaths_rate_immigration: Each spike represents the % of detained people who have died due to COVID-19 in a facility
map_active: Each spike represents the number incarcerated people who currently have COVID-19 in a facility
map_active_immigration: Each spike represents the number detained people who currently have COVID-19 in a facility
map_active_rate: Each spike represents the % of incarcerated people who currently have COVID-19 in a facility
map_active_rate_immigration: Each spike represents the % of detained people who currently have COVID-19 in a facility
map_notes:
This map displays reported COVID-19 cases and related deaths of people incarcerated in carceral facilities across the US. Click on a state to access more data.
Rates and active cases are not available for all facilities. Learn why.
map_notes_immigration: This map displays COVID-19 cases and related deaths of people detained by ICE in facilities across the US, as well as the boundaries for the 24 ICE Enforcement & Removal Operations Field Office regions.
map_tested: Each spike represents the number of incarcerated people who have been tested for COVID-19 within a facility
map_tested_rate: Each spike represents the % of incarcerated people who have been tested for COVID-19 within a facility
nat_map_title: This map displays COVID-19 cases and related deaths of people incarcerated in prisons and jails across the US. Click on a state to access more data.
state_map_title: Map of ${stateName} with spikes representing the active metric for each facility.
